info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 28 at 7:34PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS POSSIBLE THIS EVENING... Light to moderate snow showers developing from Shelby, North Carolina to Spartanburg and Greenville in South Carolina will slowly move east through the evening hours. The snow showers could become heavy enough at times to permit a dusting to a half inch of snow to accumulate on surfaces as temperatures cool to the freezing mark. Slippery conditions could develop on a few bridges and overpasses late this evening across Cleveland County in North Carolina, Cherokee, Union, and Laurens County in South Carolina, and the southern half of Greenville and Spartanburg Counties. Use caution if traveling.
